description: Blue Jays player Chris Coghlan shocked fans on Monday when he achieved flight to score an incredible run.
title: Blue Jays player scores with spectacular dive over catcher
title_page: Blue Jays player scores with spectacular dive over catcher | Daily Mail Online
text:
Blue Jays player Chris Coghlan shocked fans on Monday when he achieved flight to score a run.
It was the top of the seventh inning against the St Louis Cardinals when Blue Jays outfielder Kevin Pillar hit a deep shot into right field and Chris Coghlan took off sprinting from first base.
As the Cardinals retrieved the ball and threw it in an attempt to get him out, he rounded third and sprinted for home.
Scroll down for video
It was the top of the seventh inning against the St Louis Cardinals when Blue Jays outfielder Kevin Pillar hit a deep shot into right field and Chris Coghlan took off sprinting from first base
As the Cardinals achieved the ball and threw it in an attempt to get him out, he rounded third and sprinted for home
"I told you I wasn't gonna slide." - Chris Coghlan. pic.twitter.com/DQIG1qAYm2 â€” MLB (@MLB) April 26, 2017
He and the ball arrived at just the same time at the home plate.
Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina caught the ball and looked to tag Coghlan, but it was too late.
Coghlan launched himself into a swan dive over the catcher's head, landing in a somersault, to score the go-ahead run in a risky, thrilling and dangerous play.
The exciting play will be marveled at for years by baseball fans all over, especially seeing as no one got hurt.
He and the ball arrived at just the same time at the home plate. Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina caught the ball and looked to tag Coghlan, but it was too late
